description: misc/dist: generate tarballs for Mac OS X

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=8596f214a031 ***

misc/dist: generate tarballs for Mac OS X

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6503118

On 14 September 2012 13:22,  <r@golang.org> wrote:
> did i miss a discussion?

As of Mountain Lion we must sign the pkg installer with the Google key
for a trouble-free install. I know how to do this, but there's some
bureaucracy involved. Not sure if I'll get it done in time for
go1.0.3.

In any case, since day one we've been asked for tarballs as an
alternative for people who don't like pkg installers.

I intend to follow up this change with a re-ordering of these
installation instructions, that puts the Mac OS X package and Windows
instructions above the tarball instructions.

Does that sound sane?

On Thu, Sep 13, 2012 at 8:28 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:
> Does that sound sane?

sure.

-rob

subject: code review 6503118: misc/dist+doc: generate tarballs for Mac OS X, amend in...
